CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 07.01.2020, ALONG WITH Crl1.MC.8401/2019(A), THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: BIA] a rear 2020/KER/513 Crl.MC 8401 & 8407/2019 3+ COMMON ORDER [ Cr1.MC.8401/2019, Cr1.MC.8407/2019 ] Dated this the 7th day of January 2020 Petitioners in these cases are accused Nos.2 and 1 respectively, in Crime No.845/2011 of varkkala Police Station for having allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections 143, 147, 148, 447, 294(b), 341, 324 and 308 read with Section 149 IPc. The cases against the petitioners were committed and are_ presently pending as SC No.1875/2014 and SC No.543/2013, respectively, before the Assistant Sessions Court, Attingal. The defacto complainant/injured is the second respondent, who has_~= appeared through counsel and filed separate affidavits in these cases to the effect that the matter has _ been amicably settled with the petitioners and that he has no grievance against them. Even through offence under Section 308 IPC has been incorporated, the injuries are not life a piers 2020/KER/513 Crl1.MC 8401 & 8407/2019 -4- threatening. A report has been obtained from the investigating officer to the effect that the matter has been settled. The petitioners do not have any criminal antecedents. No public interest is involved. In the result, these Criminal M.Cs are allowed and the entire proceedings as against the petitioners pending before the Assistant Sessions Court, Attingal in SC Nos.1875/2014 and 543/2013 shall stand quashed under Section 482 cCr.PC and the petitioners/accused are discharged.
